inn1.comm: feisty start from Harmison, short and it struck a leaping Tharanga on the shoulder
swinging across the left-hander and safely left
here we go again. wide down the leg side
... and again. Harmison really struggles to control the new ball
driven unconvincingly through the vacant third slip area for a single to third man
way outside off stump. More trouble with the radar
better, straight and into the batsman's body
bouncer, and close to being another wide but the umpires glance at each other and let it go
good running. Dropped into the covers, quick call and rushed through
Kabir Ali starts with a ball just short outside off stump and Jayasuriya punches it through the covers for four
even wider, and a controlled cut placed behind square which evades a tumbling third man
better  and quicker (84mph) which the batsmen felt for and missed
short of a length and pushed defensively into the off side
beat defensive prod and loud appeal, but going over the top
good recovery from Kabir Ali, straight and on a length
this defies belief. Harmison back aiming at first slip and on target
now, thats more like it. A fast and accurate bouncer which cracks the batsman on the helmet as he took uncertain evasive action, and flew over the keeper for leg byes
slightly down the leg, clipped for a single
Jayasuriya hurried by shortish ball into his body
Harmison seems a bit more settled
scampered single into the covers
driven to short extra cover
again a fuller length and pushed to mid off
a yard fuller and that makes all the difference as Jayasuriya unleashes a lovely drive which flies to the boundary
again overpitched but this time the batsmen makes a mess of it
wide and short and an rather undignified swish by Tharanga which he misses
After the third ball Harmison switched to round the wicket and seems to have sorted out his line at least
short and Tharanga left groping at air outside off stump
Well I never. Short and wide outside off stump, slashed hard by Jayasuriya straight to the man two yards in on the deep cover boundary who barely had to move.  Inspired field placing.
Clipped off middle and leg square on the leg side for a couple
Left -  but not too wide of his off stump
again just outside the off stump and swinging away from the left hander who leaves it
Tharanga tries to avoid the packed off side by working the ball straight but not timed
Too wide and driven with conviction through extra cover

A gentle push which evades Solanki at backward point and races across the outfield and Harmison had to make a rather undignified sprawling stop on the boundary. He gets up with all the agility of a grounded giraffe
pushed into the off. That dive at the end of the previous over appears to have hurt Harmison a little and he looks a bit pained
short and gloved down the leg side to fine leg
edged through the vacant third slip area ... that's two at catching height through there to date
little more than a prod, but wonderfully timed and Cook made to chase it all the way as the ball seemed to taunt him by not slowing down
Leg side, driven wide of mid-on where Plunkett dives but doesnt stop cleanly
Driven on the up over extra cover. Ali not bowling badly but his figures undone by one four ball an over
Ali responds with a good, quick ball
Clipped to leg but no single depsite a second of confusion between the two
Leg side and a wide. Harmison undone by having to start bowling to a right hander after just getting used to a pair of lefties

Whipped from outside off stump, straight to Bell at square leg  just above head height - and the ball goers straight in straight out again. It was going quickly but at this level, it should be held. In club cricket you would duck.
Again, Harmison looking more at home bowling to the left hander
Well, until he sprays the ball down the leg side, that is
Tharanga tries to get onto the front foot but Harmison just too short to do that to
Its catching. He starts with a leg-side wide.
Too much width and hammered off the front foot over the cover fielders for four
Not one out of the coaching book but worked to leg as he gave himself room. Like Ian Dowie, ugly but effective
Lovely wristy flick through midwicket. That was the beauty to the previous shot's beast
chipped over mid-on for two
yet again , Plunkett gives Jayawardene plenty of width and he runs the ball to third man. A poor first over.
bad start, wide and launched over extra cover for four
proded past Dalrymple at a diving point

AGH! Uncontrolled drive which flew high to Dalrymple at point and he parried the chance and slipped as he tried to scamper for the rebound. Might be harsh, but you suspect that Collingwood, who normally fields there, would have held it
pushed down the ground for a single
Driven firmly to Strauss at mid-off, clean pick up and shy at the stumps which would have left Jayawardene two yards short had he hit
Edged drive wide to the left of Solanki at backward point and Bresnan picks up on the boundary and falls over in the process
Slashed over backward point and only a couple of yards short of the inrushing Bresnan and third man
punched into the covers
lovely drive through extra cover. He thrives on width but has looked less easy when its straight  but Englands bowlers have not been consistent enough to tie him down
a bit more of a slash, made room and launched over the ring in the covers
now that was ugly, moved to leg, aimed a swish and got nothing
bit of a heave but it was effective, through wide midwicket where Harmison chugged after it
through Solanki at backward point
gave himself room and slashed to third man. The last time I saw a batsman move that far to leg was in the Caribbean when my club captain was cowering after smacking a fast man over the top for four
walked down the track and smacked through Dalrymple in the covers. The bowler unimpressed
again down the pitch but not fielded cleanly at short fine-leg
now Tharanga on the move as Plunkett bowls. Only four off the over which is a result of sorts
lofted drive over mid-on, plugged on landing in a way which would have impressed Tiger Woods and stopped inches short of the rope
Harmison responds with a wide, England's 58th of the series so far, Cricinfo's answer to Bill Frindall tells me
flicked to leg for a walked single
another wide down the leg, Harmison's 18th of the series. The stats keep coming
controlled edge down to third man where Plunkett made a superb diving stop to his left
wide ball slashed squarer and Plunkett could only watch that race away to his right
opened the face of the bat and driven to the cover sweeper
driven through the covers and Bell scurries round from sweeper to field
Tharanga makes room and squeezes through the covers for another couple
Jawaydene came down the pitch and chipped from high on the bat just over a tumbling Solanki at midwicket
deftly run through the slips for four. The PA pumps out The Heat Is On. Theyre not wrong
better line and length
flicked in the air on the leg but once through the infield it was four all the way
too  much width and an easy two to bring up Jayawardenes 50 off only 32 balls
wristy flick to leg and easy single
a carbon copy of the previous shot, only in reverse
overpitched and a comfortable sweep to bring up Tharangas fifty off 60 balls. These two have now added 104 off 84 balls
we've reached that stage when it's easy singles and all a bit soporific
dainty flick to the leg side
tip-and-run to the off side
more of the same
whoa  slumber disturbed by a raucous appeal for leg-before as batsman shaped to turn to leg but not close enough
Tharanga used his feet but Dalrymple saw him coming and floated ball into his feet
driven past a diving bowler to long-on
rocketed to deep cover, but Bell slides to keep it a single
tucked down to third man
edged to third man
pulled to the square leg boundary
attempted reverse sweep just hits his bat
thats better. Steps and slaps the ball with consummate control over midwicket
the ball just comes on with the arm
pulls out the sweep from his locker
cheeky aerial dink into space

How rude of me not to say hello. Hello. Now, youve got to feel for Cook and I, making our debuts in this dead rubber. Still, at least the kettles only a short hop for me  and my colleagues. Subtlety was never my strong suit.

Vikram Solanki is introduced here for a bit of variety and his part-time offspin
ouch.
straight through mid-off
beats the outside edge. A bit of turn there, leaving the left-handed Tharanga and Jones whips the bails off, just to show he can.
Bresnan cuts off the ball on the square-leg boundary
Tharanga gives himself room and takes a few steps on the charge, only to find Solanki at extra-cover who takes a straightforward catch. A badly needed breakthrough for England.

off the mark with a quick push on the on-side. A good over from Dalrymple.

If you're just joining us for a spot of pre-lunch jollity (or not, as the case may be) my colleague Will Luke has wrapped up  the first 20 overs.
Ali tucks Sangakkara up and he pushes to short mid-wicket
this time Sangakkara gets the ball away through mid-wicket although he didnt quite time it
through the on-side again, as Alis line strays a touch down leg once more
bowling to the righthander this time, Ali goes down his legside and Jayawardene helps the ball into midwicket
tucked up, but still scrambles a single. A slip has been moved in for Harmison as the Solanki experiment ends. Its getting very gloomy at Old Trafford, and so is the weather, boom boom.
stroked firmly to cover, but its scooped up and thats a better over, with just two runs from it.
whipped through square
darted in at his legs, but digs out a leg bye
not a great ball, down leg, and a no-ball to boot.
helped into the mid-wicket area.
flick of the wrist to cover.
handsome late cut to deep third man. Less gorgeous is the rain that's starting to fall at Old Trafford.
around the wicket, steep bounce and its too good for Sangakkara who flashes high and hard and the ball arcs through to Jones.
more steep bounce and the ball sails through to the keeper. This is good stuff, Harmison has come back well after his opening spell which included six wides.
same again from Harmison, Dilshan must feel very welcome here
Dilshan finally gets bat on ball. Harmison is in menacing form.
a good leave. Dilshan lets the ball sail on through to the keeper
clipped behind square for easy runs.
mix-up avoided as the batsmen set off for a quick single, but decide to go back. A wise move.
tries to go wide of the crease, and ends up just bowling wide. Rubbish
two come along at once: another leg-side wide from Ali.
the full face of the bat on view as Jayawardene administers a straight drive.
played off his hips through midwicket. Hes batting really nicely here, but he wont be impressed with Dilshan running one short. Not the sort of thing you expect to see at international level.
miscued pull, spliced into space on the on-side.
beautiful pull shot. Fully in control, helps a poor delivery just behind square. Have some of that.

lovely drive through cover. But that will be that for a while as rain plays spoilsport at Old Trafford. The covers are pulled on very quickly - the groundstaff could definitely give those well-drilled packs at Wimbledon a run for their money - but then again they will need to be fast: it's very squelchy around the wicket area.

The umpires have had a look at conditions  its still raining, but less heavily than before. We could be on for a restart soonish.

While were all waiting for play to resume why not read Tim de Lisles excellent piece on Englands one-day woes?

Hurrah! The covers are coming off.
wide delivery, cut down through point and bobbles on the second bounce, past a luckless Bresnan who slips and lands on his back

steer into the midwicket area.

A tidy over from Ali, but Sri Lanka are still very much in the ascendancy, with Jayawardene comfortable and heading towards his century.
a wristy waft, fails to connect. Good area from Plunkett, the ball heads just over off-stump.
straight, true and Plunkett gets the reward  the off-stump is pegged back. Dilshan was trying to make room for himself.
a neat flick through leg, where Cook is waiting to grab the ball and fire it in back.

State of play update: no overs have been lost to the rain. Even thought 20 minutes were lost to the rain, the interval will now be reduced to half an hour. Good reshuffling from the admin fellas there, and Strauss follows suit with a shuffle of his own  bringing on Ian Bell.
drifting down the leg side
slightly short and bit wide outside the off stump, Arnold waits for the ball to pass the stumps and then taps it past the keeper, almost took it of the keeper's gloves, well played
tossed up outside the off stump, Jayawardene steps forward and forces it away behind point, no room for a single there
worked away off the pads to the square leg region
better line and length, Jayawardene looking to work it way on the leg side closes the face of the bat bit too early and the leading edge goes past the bowler, close call
short ball, drifting onto middle and leg, Jayawardene waits for the ball and the at the last possible moment spoons it away to the fine leg fence, lovely shot
again worked away in a similar fashion to the deep square leg region
that's the end of that! Arnold attempts another cheeky dab and this time he ends up with a faint edge, Jones holds on well to a fairly hard chance - Sri Lanka five down
swivel pull for his hundred. Well batted that man; thats two hundreds on the bounce. He needed just 82 deliveries to do it, in a knock that included nine fours. Its been a joy to watch. Top timing.
defended outside the off stump

simplest return catch popped up and theres no mistake made by the bowler who snaffles the leading edge. Jayawardenes cross with himself, but he neednt be  thats been a lovely innings and hes left his team in a strong position to hit the 300-mark.
defended outside the off stump
proded into the off side but the fielders pounce onto the ball
sneaked down to third man but not controlled
on the mark
driven back hard, canons off the bowler and loops over the umpire
clipped to leg
this is sensible tight bowling and Maharoof too cramped tobe able to get it away
controlled shot off the face of the angled bat down to third man
Maharoof forced onto the back foot and no power in the shot
Angled off the back foot behind square on the off and Harmison creaks round to field
a wide down the leg but Jones took it and hovered as the batsman wobbled in his crease but just kept his balance
nice teamwork on the deep extra-cover boundary to save a four, one dives, one throws
comfortable single to end the over
hit hard back at the bowler
played for spin, went on with the arm so he missed it
run out for one on the off
a single up to long-on
unconvincing appeal but it turned and sneaked past the bat
wide but not timed into the covers
forced onto the back foot
just what England needed, a clear-cut wide that only swung away from the left-hander and got even wider
squeezed out into the covers
well, it was straight at least
genuine edge that would have been swallowed by a slip but England cannot afford such a luxury with the bowlers so wayward
flicked off the front foot staright to midwicket
turned from the off to long-on
top-edged a sweep from outside off stump but into no-mans land
turned a mile and ended wide down the leg, Jones snatches at it and the ball ricocheted off his fingertips with Maharoof sprawling in the dirt
leg-bye rolls square and Jones scampers to field. The end of a really good spell from the Middlesex man
inside edge bounces just behind the stumps and Jones considers shying at the bowlers end but with no one backing up, opts not to
a pull which looked the business but he barely connected. One for the photographers
Sri Lanka taking singles almost at will, and they had such a good start that that will give them a formidable score
shaped to run the ball towards third man, possibly bounced a bit more than he expected,  and a thickish edge straight to Jones
a straight ball to end a much better over from Plunkett
bouncer which sails past the batsmans head and Bresnan tries a hard stare but looks not remotely threatening
single to Trescothick rushing in from extra cover but safely home  and he missed the stumps anywhere
in the air, wide a diving Solanki at backward point and Dalrymples lunge on the boundary cannot quite stop the four
clipped up to long on
daft. Hes had his one bouncer for the over and so he bangs in another one even shorter
cut wide and Plunkett, who was slow to pick the ball up, recovered brilliantly at third man to make a sprawling stop on the rope
yorker well dug out and a scampered single as the ball bobbled to mid-on
bouncer which the batsman does a limbo to
short again but fenced down second bounce to third man
pitched up and Maharoof cracks it to the extra-cover boundary with real venom
tried the same again but with less power and the man brought in for that shot saves the single
Harmison looks better with the old ball. Right on the button first up
and again
pushed straight, Harmison tried to stop it with his boot and it then races past a diving Trescothick and mid-off. It was barely more than a defensive prod.
down the leg side again. You have to ask what the bowling coach is doing between matches ...
single to Trescothick who has been pushed back at long-off
defensive prod into the covers, seven off the over
dreadful ball  a full toss  but superbly dispatched over extra cover for a two-bounce boundary
aimed to leg but it looped over Strausss head at extra cover
this is pathetic from an international bowler. A second waist-high full toss edged for four to third man
a slow ball, pitched up and lofted with ease ten rows back over long-on. Four balls, 15 runs.
a dot ball!
a good slower ball to finish an otherwise dismal over
gives himself room, Harmison follows him, and the ball is driven to deepish mid-on
getting a bit carried away, Bandara aims a shot that would have sent the ball into Accrington and misses
tip and run to get Maharoof back on strike
chucked everything at it and the ball went high into space on the off for two
Harmison again followed the batsman as he made room, and went between his legs. Would have been a wide in normal circumstances
big swing and smacked past Harmison who wisely opts to remove his hand from the path of the ball. No call for heroics at this stage
another full toss, but only a single this time
yet another full toss and it got all it deserved, hammered for six over square leg. Maharoof brings up his fifty and his sides 300. Ali is dreadful.
Ali overcompensates with a short slower ball which is thwacked into the crowd at midwicket.
guess  go on. Yes, a full toss which Maharoof skies and Jones runs round to take a catch .. but rightly called a no-ball
the good news is that it actually pitched. The bad news is that it was short and pulled square for another four
another full toss, hit square. It should have been called as it was above waist height but the umpire clearly wants to get off before sunset
a dot ball to end an over which produced 20 runs.

inn2.comm: good shape, bends past Trescothicks bat. The batsman did leave it, though.
dab to third man to get off the mark
big flash just past a diving second slip. Finds the boundary.

push to cover, Jayasuriya bends down and fumbles with his right hand. They look for two, but choose not to run on a misfield, as a wise man must have once told them. But Trescothick wasn't listening when same said wise man suggested 'Always run the first one hard' - he just jogged.
good start from Malinga, pace and movement back into the left-handed Cook who bends double.
a hurried single, but Cooks bat was well-grounded running to the non-strikers end.
on the button again and Trescothick moves on to his backfoot to show a perfect defensive.
firm defensive. Good first over from Malinga, hostile and on the money.
ball moves away as it rises through to Sangakkara.
confident punch through the covers after coming down the pitch.
down the pitch again, this time the well-timed four sails over mid-on; it wasn't a bad ball from Vaas, by any stretch.
tucked up, forced on to the backfoot; good comeback there from Vaas.
tried to work one through the midwicket, but too straight to be attempting that shot.
defensive push, Bandara swoops in the covers.
lucky to get away with that. The ball was banged in, came on to the bat too quickly and Cooks miscued hook found space at fine leg.
a convincing steer to mid-off.
hard flash, swipes air  luckily for him. Sangakkara pouches the ball.
sleekly clipped through mid-wicket.
big leave.
tucked up, but gets bat firmly on it.
good length ball, just outside off-stump. Cook tries to cut it, but theres not enough width.
speared in at yorker length, did well to dig that out with a last-second jab of the bat.
beautiful whip over midwicket off a slightly short one.
smashed to cover, but well stopped.
another yorker, dug out: well watched.
a touch wide of off-stump and the balls helped down to wide third man.
a bit of movement away from the left-handed Trescothick, but he gets bat on it and steers it down to third man.
defensive prod.
and another defensive push.
strays down leg, slapped fine.
nice. Smooth. A lovely aerial four over mid-wicket. Like that.
lash to point, picked up well.
lucky, lucky boy. Trescothick shaped to cut a short one which flies straight to Sangkkara who points his gloves up to catch  and just parries the ball down. Let off.
another chance  this time Malinga stretches out his right hand but the ball just eludes him and flies away straight.
a huge bouncer which is called a wide on height.
another four through the covers.
starts with a slower ball, defended into the covers.
long hop dragged down, helped round the corner. Great shot.
short, wide and got the treatment: crunched through the offside. The fielders had no chance.
drops his hands and dinks the ball down for a cheeky single. Clever cricket.
nearly gets the wicket he deserves, at last; but Trescothick, fortunately for him, just fails to get an edge on that.
good length ball, fired in at the legs.
splendid yorker, jolly well done. Trescothick gives a wry smile after digging that out - as well he might, he's being tested here.
comfortable single. Malinga's bowling really well here, creating chances and difficulties all over the shop, but without having purchased a wicket yet. There's still time...
one of the most gorgeous shots in cricket. Trescothick steps forward and lifts a sumptuous six, high and straight, and it just plops over the rope.
paddled round fine, for nothing.
strays down leg, just moved too much.
pulls out of a drive and the ball pops up, but nowhere dangerous.
well bowled, but well played, too -  squeezed fine for four.
a similar story. Dug out a good-length ball and timed it superbly straight for four.
another decent delivery which Cook just gets bat on and they run a cheeky single.

hit with power, but at waist height and to cover. An important wicket for Sri Lanka, and one which had been coming for Malinga. England cant afford to lose any momentum here, now. Ian Bell strides to the crease.
an unusual misfield for the normally safe Dilshan who grasps at air at deep gully and the ball runs for four.
Dilshan dives to his right this time, but there wasnt much he could do as that ball just races away across the lightning-quick outfield.
big leave of a wideish ball.

huge inside edge chopped on to his leg stump, and Cook departs, just 11 runs shy of what would have been his debut half-century. But more importantly there are two new men at the crease - they will need to play themselves in fast.
firmly dinked cut, a nice shot.

another chop wide of third man.

England are just about up with the run-rate, but they will need to keep the scoreboard ticking.
good length delivery, Strauss just gets bat on it.
short and wide and Strauss misses out on that  he mistimes it over to third man.
good line and length.
like a magician with a saw, he cut the big man in half.
turned into the gap at midwicket and an easy two
straight and cramps Strauss who has no freedom to unwind
neatly turned wide of the man at midwicket for two
driven firmly to long-on
short and this time Strauss gets the width he craves and he slams the ball to the cover boundary. The music blasts out and the crowd briefly come to life
carbon copy of the previous ball and the shot, and this time the crowd does show some genuine enthusiasm
same line but pitched up and Strauss can only squeeze into the covers
again a better ball and no runs. And it's time for the first drinks break.
run down to third man
Vaas has taken the pace off the ball, Sangakkara is standing up and Strauss is being tucked up and restricted
onto the back foot and played out into the covers. This is good, tight bowling
really neat over, only the two singles and this will quickly start putting pressure on England  after their good start
driven to the man at deepish mid-off. Jayasuriya happy to give the one there, but not so amused with the no-ball
worked nicely behind square where Vaas, who has come up into the ring from fine leg,  chases but the ball never quite slows down enough for him to catch it
single to Jayasuriya  picking on the old boy
With the off side packed, Maharoof sprays it down the leg and Bell swishes the ball over the top through wide midwicket
opens the face and runs the ball to third man
tip and run to mid-off and a wild throw well backed up
Vaas is really doing the business in stifling Strauss, angling the ball into him
a bit wider and Strauss aims to run the ball fine and misses it
Strauss might start to get a bit edgy about being tied down
all the hard work wasted as Vaas bowls it wide and a relieved Strauss cuts with glee to the square boundary
and overpitched final ball clipped to mid-on
turned to leg
England taking singles and Jayasuriya seemingly quite satisfied to allow that
waited for that one and cracked off the back foot to deep extra cover. However, the batsmen were ambling as they didn't think Malinga would get to it  but it he did and they missed a third
this time they scamper as if their lives depended on it and a wayward throw helps their cause
sloppy fielding. It was always two but a weak throw and poor recovery from Sangakkara added to the feeling of it being a bit shabby
waited for it and turned to leg
an oh-so-delicate four as Strauss runs it off the face of the bat down to third man
driven wide a sprawling bowler to long-off
attempted flick to leg but got in a bit of a muddle and ball bobbed up off his feet
a single at the end of the over, worked behind square on the leg, but thats not nearly enough and the pressure slowly mounts
as the dots grow in number, so does the pressure
a backfoot drive into the off side from around middle stump
angled between the fielders on the off.
turned to the deep midwicket fielder but never a chance of two
England are being strangled here by some tight bowling and the rate is creeping towards seven an over
a single to long-off
the noose grows tighter
squirreled to midwicket
a run a ball with ease  but England need a few boundaries as the rate is now 7.00
used his feet but only to pat the ball back
driven hard enough to beat extra cover but still only the one
good running to get two to the man at deep midwicket
swept round the corner
a nothing shot that is cut into the ground and it bounces beyond Sangakkara enabling them to run one
not an ideal line and clipped to leg
ferreted one into the covers
driven straight down to long-on
not quite contolled, ended up as a one-handed waft down behind square on the leg

the pressure tells Strauss tries to glance the ball down to third man and the ball runs off the face of the bat to a whooping Sangakkara. Thats a result of the previous overs as much as that delivery.

When you are down, things just always go against you  Bell hit the ball into the ground, it bounced up and struck Sangakkara on the chest, into his chin and and lobbed down onto the top of the stumps with Bell out of his ground. Its hardly textbook wicketkeeping but its in the book and England are wobbling
Dalrymple looked for a second as if he was going to reverse sweep but thought better of it
crucial over, a wicket maiden
played into the off side with all the pace taken off the ball
squirmed down leg side and Sangakkara sprints like a man chased by demons and saves the two
squeeling appeal from Sangakkara as the ball seems to hit the pad before the bat
Its all gone a bit sleepy  a run a ball and the crowd snoozing in the Manchester sunshine
athletic stop by the bowler diving to his right
Solanki uses his feet to drive
England havent hit a boundary for more than half an hour and the asking rate is heading towards double figures.  Ones and twos are simply not enough any more
Inside edge without much clue
good running by Dalrymple to the danger end
swept off middle stump. Batting by numbers but it needs some risk taking
good improvisation and the ball actually got within five yards of the boundary, which is an achievement in itself
normal service resumed
attempted cut but off balance and missed and ended up staggering back like a drunk at closing time

and that was the shot of a drunk at closing time. Came down the pitch for the big heave, missed it, and a more orthodox stumping for Sangakkara, who took the ball well low-down, with not a hint of chin. In fairness to Solanki, he was in a no-win situation
missed an attempted clip to leg and an amazing appeal given that leg stump could be seen
tight two made easy as the fielders got in each others way
There are only so many ways of describing a one by arrangement, where the bowler and fielder are happy to allow it and the batsmen can do no more than take the meagre scraps on offer
Staright back to bowler who collides and upends the non-striker as he scrambles for the ball. A yellow card in Germany  red with some referees
well run couple to leg
nasty swish which he missed
attempted sweep which he missed but leg byes this time
genuine sweep of leg stump to the backward square-leg boundary
straight drive, half-hearted attempt to get to it by the bowler.

big swing to leg high to deep midwicket where Malinga on the rope could not cling on  even had he held it, he would have been on the line. The first boundary since the UK had a Conservative government ... so it seems
the corpse twitches as Jones drives the ball hard and high over extra cover. Four or five of those an over and we have a contest
Jones at least giving it a go
creamed to deep midwicket
well-hit reverse sweep
Jones briefly sparkled but he has holed out to Maharoof at long-on and its all over bar the shouting
They crossed  and Dalrymple ended the over with a smear over midwicket

drive to longish-on for one
through the batsman and Sangakkara makes a sprawling semi-stop
a shot which would delight a club tailender, gloriously worked over the keepers head for four

two runs, but a misfield opens the opportunity for a third. Sadly,  only Bresnan sees it and by the time he realises that Dalrymple is impersonating a limpet, hes stranded and Sangakkara gently lobs the ball into the stumps
reverse swept with little conviction
It's all gone rather flat as the match meanders to a finish. But a really good spell from Bandara which really turned the screw at a crucial time.
hammered high into space around long-on where the fielders combine to fall over when they finally get there

down the leg and a few boos as no wide signalled, but Plunkett did move to the off

fast full toss and returned with interest, flying into the crowd behind long-on.

straight and Dalrymple aims a big hit but misses and the ball takes his middle and off stumps.  Dalrymple departs, one of the few England players to have emerged from today  and this series  with any credit

Kabir Ali pushes into the off, Fernando scurries across, picks up, turns and throws down the stumps with Ali not even in the frame   Ali trudges off to contemplate a dismal day  0 for 77 from 10 overs and a first-ball duck.  Hes probably got a parking ticket as well.
up in the blockhole and bounced back over the bowler
effortlessly driven over the infield for a single. If the game had been alive they might have tried for a second.
full toss but missed it
another seemingly effortless clip over midwicket

holed out to deep mid-off to end the match, although the contest was finished some time back. The delighted Sri Lankans leave the field to the whoops of their vocal supporters, but the stands are three-quarter empty as people have been drifting off for some time.
